column3: University of Pennsylvania, The Wharton School

column7: BSOS Summer Scholar: [Behavioral data analysis of how confronting prejudice affects interpersonal relationships](https://www.keanarichards.com/publication/bsos_summer_scholars/)
column8: Research assistant with the Identity and Diversity Management Lab and the Language and Music Cognition Lab

column7: Planned and directed multiple research projects in collaboration with researchers in Psychology, Marketing, Engineering, Management, Mathematics, and Human Development departments across 3 institutions
column8: Designed qualitative (e.g., grouped text responses into themes) and quantitative (e.g., created surveys) studies to analyze impact of identity on labor market decisions, with the potential to reduce disparities across social groups
column9: [Master's thesis in Statistics](https://github.com/keanarichards/stats-masters): ran multilevel linear models in R to analyze the impact of race and voice pitch on person perception; presented results at international conference attended by 3800 academic and industry professionals
column10: Designed and earned funding for A/B tests determining whether virtual reality intervention affects racial prejudice ($6000) and whether competition affects gender differences in preparation ($20000)
column11: Supervised psychology honors student in designing experimental research project, presenting research, and writing honors thesis, culminating in research award
column12: Led workshop on [Data entry, cleaning, and reproducible data management/analysis practices in R](https://github.com/keanarichards/data-mgt-workshop/) during research assistant training

column7: Summarized empirical evidence on how to promote inclusion, safety, and innovation in organizations through white papers
column8: Composed technical report explaining methodology and implementation of organizational change assessment
column9: Developed 360-degree feedback survey to assess the frequency of emotion regulation behaviors among government employees

column7: Presented empirical research about brain function during substance use to 40 clients
column8: Developed evidence-based stress management program and led 40 clients through program during treatment interventions
